{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3526662,"name":"Ryan Wu","username":"Ryan1432","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/59ef9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T01:47:26.827Z","cooked":"

I am trying to use shuffleboard to accept video from two cameras on Raspberry Pi. The shuffleboard can display video from the two cameras simultaneously, but not alternatively. When streaming both cameras, I can see cameras in CameraServer of shuffleboard. When streaming alternatively, I cannot see the server in shuffleboard (see attached figure). but I can use IP address (http://raspberrypi-5.local:1183/) to watch the video. Any suggestions where I should check? My code was copied below.

image512×975 13.3 KB

import time
from cscore import CameraServer, MjpegServer, UsbCamera

CameraServer.enableLogging()

Create two USB cameras

cam1 = UsbCamera(name=“Camera1”, path=“/dev/video0”)
cam2 = UsbCamera(name=“Camera2”, path=“/dev/video2”)
CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture(camera=cam1)
CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture(camera=cam2)

Set resolution (optional)

cam1.setResolution(640, 480)
cam2.setResolution(640, 480)

Create an MJPEG server for streaming

switcher = MjpegServer(“SwitchedStream”, port=1183)
switcher.setSource(cam1) # Start with cam1

current_camera = cam1

Streaming loop

switch_time = 5 # Switch every 5 seconds
start_time = time.time()
use_cam1 = True # Start with Camera 1

while True:
current_time = time.time()

# Check if we need to switch cameras
if current_time - start_time > switch_time:
    if use_cam1:
        switcher.setSource(cam2)  # Switch to Camera 2
    else:
        switcher.setSource(cam1)  # Switch to Camera 1

    use_cam1 = not use_cam1  # Toggle camera
    start_time = current_time  # Reset timer

time.sleep(0.1)  # Small delay to avoid excessive CPU usage
